Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
I think I know what your trying to say but its a little more complicated that that the top one is more like this:
in "normal mode"
block 1
block 2
block 3 with tx - check point at block 1
block 4
block 5
block 6
block 7
block  8 with tx - checkpoint at block 6
block 9
block 10
block 11
block 12
block 13 with tx - checkpoint at block 11
Also if a notarisaion is confirmed out of order, the one which is older block hash is ignored ... in this case I  am not sure that matters exactly as your proposing a 100% attack and i dont think there is really anyhting that cna be done if someone has 100% of the hash power of a chain.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: However with just 1% of the hash power

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The chain that is not notrised is not notarised .. and if the chain has very low hash power.... then anyone not waiting for a notrisation for a large amount of funds is quite foolish.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: In your second example ... all you did was double spend on an un notrised chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If youchanged the block 1, then the notrisation tx included in block 3 is now invlaid.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: At worst with this attack is your making the chain totally unusable until you stop doing it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and at best, someone mines 1 notarisation tx and creates a checkpoint... also constantly reorginf hte chain will probably stop the notary nodes reeaching consesnus until you stop doing it... so while your trying to do this, there will be no new notarisations happening.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: While this attack is possible, I dont really see it a that large of a problem as its a lot of effort for not a lot of gain other then being a dick and pissing people off.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: One thing I did discuss with Alright once, was that your could constantly force 1-3 bock reorgs ... over and over

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that would stop the notary nodes every making any notarisions at all.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But he said hte logistics of that are all but impossible and it doesnt really achive anything.

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
It's not "private" when peers follow it
it's not "notarized" if the block-maker refuses to add the notarization tx
ergo, it's neither private or notarized

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
in an ideal world, everyone follows the rules
I'm simply pointing out that if one chooses not to follow the rule and NN don't actually produce blocks, then it's an easily broken system because there's no forced enforcement of the rules
If CHAINX only has 1 pool and I can outblock that pool then I'm free to make as many blocks as I wish and at any point I can roll back the chain to the point where I refused to add the notarization and add it and they are forced to accept it because tx=notarized

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: at that point anything spent after the ignored tx block and before the rollback is voided
